cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HER BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTCONFIDENTIALC.P.(56) 138COPY NO.6th June, 1956CABINETNUCLEAR AND ALLIED RADIATIONSMemorandum by the Lord President of the council the Atomic Energy (Official) Committee have considered thereport of the Medical Research Council on the Hazards to Man of Nuclearand Allied Radiations. The Committee have no comments to make on theconclusions of the report except to express the view that some of theserequire detailed consideration in consultation with the appropriatescientific, medical and industrial bodies concerned. The committee recommend that Departments should proceed with this consideration assoon as possible.2. With regard to the presentation of the report to Parliament, theCommittee feel that this might be accompanied by a short statement tothe effect that (a) the report will be considered in detail with theappropriate bodies and (b) Her Majes.ty's Government were aware of theconclusions of the report when making their announcement to parliament on nuclear tests on 7th June.S.Privy Council Office, S.W.1.5th June, 1956.
